intro: Malvastrum ribifolium, commonly known as the redroot sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, showy yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its roots are reddish in color, which gives it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Malvastrum ribifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in native plant gardens.
